poem:
**Morning Headlines**

Sunak, grilled, 
croons to Johnson:
"Happy Birthday."

Admiration lingers
in politics' cold air, 
soft smiles amidst 
the tolls on family.

Truths and lies mix,
like morning mist in
gritty city streets,

and the newsprint smudges 
with each touch— 
life, a brief 
message whispered.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Rishi Sunak grilled on Farage, national service and NHS on LBC general election phone-in – live 9.02am BST Q: Do you have a message for Boris Johnson on his 60th birthday? Sunak says he does, “Happy Birthday”. It is great to have him supporting Tory candidates. Ferrari asks if there is anything he admires about Keir Starmer. Sunak says these jobs take a toll on family. He thinks Starmer is good at making time for". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
